result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Deondre Fowler Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All counts concurrent; concurrent with 14CM1841; consecutive to 12CF2604.

miscConds.notes: $543 costs--DOC collect.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim, S.B., her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  May have 3rd party contact for purposes of child visitation.
Any treatment/counseling as deemed necessary; follow through with all caregivers' recommendations.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas Deondre Fowler in court in custody with attorney Andria M. Adams.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adams withdraws motion to withdraw as counsel.  
No contest plea to counts 1, 2, 3, 4 and 7, Court finds defendant guilty.  
Sentence withheld, Court orders 3 years probation each count, concurrent with each other and concurrent with 14CM1841, consecutive to 12CF2604, with conditions:  No contact with S.B.; may have 3rd party contact for purposes of child visitation; comply with any testing/treatment deemed necessary and follow through with all caregivers' recommendations; DOC to collect $2,415 costs; no sentence credit.  Deportation warning advised.  Counts 5 and 6 dismissed and read in.
Defendant Thomas Deondre Fowler in court in custody with attorney Andria M. Adams.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Continue as set.
03-12-2015, Original filed in 12CF2604
